ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to read Japanese Poetry, and also how to analyze it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very interesting material and scintillating discussions. No real weaknesses.
An amazing course--I have no comments on how it could be changed. It was organized and executed very well.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's very interesting and eye opening. I think that this course is great because anyone, even if they aren't used to this sort of material, can really learn a lot and enjoy it.

This class was amazing! Kamens is incredibly insightful and amazing to listen to, and will make you interested in whatever you happen to be going over in class at the time. Definitely make sure you're prepared and awake for class--it makes discussions way more stimulating and cool. This class is also a rare occurrence--Kamens is a leading voice in his field, but the class is small and discussion-based. You really get to hear and think about a lot of interesting poetic topics in this class.

extras.title:
EALL 536 01/LITR 181 01/EALL 236 01
        Japanese Poetry and Poetics TR/Japanese Poetry and Poetics
